author: AddictedToStyrene
title: Rebel Troops!
review: Another silly little ship but a really great way to build an army. Now you can create the Rebel Blockade Runner in minifig scale (good luck with that!) or populate your Rebel base with X-wings, Y-wings and plenty of ground crew. Actually the little ship doesn't look as odd as the Imperial one, but it's a set that is best for collecting Rebel soldiers.

author: Jon_Brick
title: Finally some rebels.
review:
It's about time TLC made some rebels that weren't from the battle of Hoth.The speeder is sleek and very well done althought it only has one gun so if the guy controling it gets shot the rebels can't attack. The rebels were done well but I was expecting them to look like the ones on Endor. This is a must have for your lego star wars collection.

pros: 
4rebels  
good speeder 

cons: 
speeder has one gun

author: Moscadini
title: Rebels Are Go....
review:
I believe that this is an Excellent Addition to the Rebels, especially if you want to start building your Rebel Army.

Pros -

Comes with 4 NEW Rebel Soldiers
Detachable Turret
2 Rifles and 2 guns
It is not expensive in the USA


Cons -
They could have made either a Captain Rebel Soldier or a Pilot Soldier

author: Jedd_the_Jedi
title: Great for a basic set
review: This set is not as interesting as its Imperial counterpart on the whole, but provides a basic platform to create your own repulsor-lift ships. The design is very simple but quite effective, and the all-new Rebel troops finally give Lego Star Wars collectors a chance to build up a decent Rebel army. The helmets look great, apart from the fact that you cannot actually pull down the visor. The detaching turret is a nice feature as well. Still, it suffers from too high a price here in Singapore, costing a hefty $30 (about US $20)

author: Oggo
title: YIPPEE REBEL TROOPERS!
review:
At last they did those rebel troopers, I have been waiting for them really long time!
The speeder doesn´t show in the movies but it have still good design.
I give 5 out of 5.
The rebel troopers and their helmets look great, and HURRAY rebels don´t have those old smiley faces like in the HOTH troops.


I hope they do next EPISODE II clone troopers battle pack(I don´t have any) and those ENDOR rebels

author: thepeopleperson
title: Finally!
review:
Lego finally made rebel troopers! And this set comes with 4! The ship is awesome, and it is very sleek and pretty big for only $10.  Here are some pros and cons.

pros-
Some of the best minifigs ever
the blaster turret is detachable
the ship is really cool
the blasters
great army builder
new 2008 parts
comes with extra stickers

cons-
None!

This is in my opinion the best set for 2008 and also the best battle pack produced so far.  Definitely buy this set. Good job, Lego!!

author: stewie12
title: Rebel Scout Speeder
review:
I first went to Toys "R" Us and saw that the price was $12.99, then I headed to Target and the price there was $9.99(I noticed TRU had many other overpriced sets, when target had a few sets that were a dollar or a couple cents cheaper than the price listed in mags.) So I got it at Target.

The helmets in this set are great, and the guns are awesome. It's a great set to build your army, of course. It has 1 more piece than its rival, Imperial Dropship.

A must for any LEGO Star Wars fan.

author: tauntaunwampa
title: Nice Minifigures
review:
I got this set mainly because of the minifigs because these are the fist to come out of this type. I have it set up infront of me now and it looks really good all i am wondering about was the spare stickers?? What were they for fortunatly my friend that was building the little thing with me said they were spares. Now to the Pros and Cons

PROS 
NEW BATTLE PACK
nice minifigs
small set (i like it when it iss like this)
Helmets

CONS
Gunholders on the side WHY
Snipe guns (maybe it should of had other guys in it

VEry Good Set needed for every collection.

author: Legonater
title: Very Nice Speeder.
review:
I just got this set on Monday. I was thinking abaout saving for the Hailfire droid first, but I'm glad with my decision. It comes with four new rebal troops, three of witch sit crammed in the front with the last manning the cannon. I noted the extra stickers in confusion. I decided I'd using them later in a drawing of some sort. The blaster holders are a nice bonus, so you don't have guns ratteling around in the speeder as you drive. The cannon detaches and makes a nice turret. The cannon itself has a minpr flaw, the trooper who controls it is vulnerable to some shooting at him, which means others must rush to control before an imperial troop. The speeder is longer then I thought It would be. I you only have one person in it, it cuold be used for cargo. The helmets are too bulky. When I saw the LSW2 Game, they seemed a little large, but here they seem larger. The viser can't come down to protect their face either. In the game, though, It appeares to be painted on. But if so, why didn't they do that here?
But anyways, good set for 12 bucks.

author: Skut
title: Rebel Combat Bobsled Team
review:
Good army builder set. Most of the other reviewers have covered the field, so I'll just add a couple of points people may find relevant:
* the picture of this set is misleading - you get 4 minifigs, not just the 2 pictured (tut tut Lego, way to undersell your own product!)
* the set is possibly a bit overpriced for Australian buyers at AUD20, but hey I guess filling a set with minifigs costs more than filling it with 4x2 bricks.
* a few reviewers have raved about the speeder but frankly a model refrigerator would be more intimidating.It looks like the Rebel Alliance's entry into a new Winter Olympics sport: combat bobsled!

author: Da_LegoBuilder
title: rouge squadron...
review: 4 rebels... looks like the ones in ep.4. The turret comes off to defend the outpost. this has so many minifigs and i would take so many of these, but they need to make a rebel tank that stands a change to an at st. mine came with an extra switch, but that was all the extra peices that i got.

author: GreatBear
title: Good Kit
review:
This is a great little vehicle kit.
The speeder actually looks like the speeders scene in SW, especially the armed Naboo speeder seen in Phantom Menace.
The "Rebel Troopers" are actually the Alderani spacers seen at the beginning of A New Hope, but they also appear in at the end of the film as rebels so I guess I can let that go. And you get 4 mini figures - that's not clear in some of the photographs.
Great vehicle. Good figures - I give it 4/5

author: andy94
title: build your rebel army!
review:
This is a great set because it has 4 totally new rebel soldiers.

Pros
-a lot of minifigs
-detachable cannon
-nice speeder design

Cons
-none

If you have the imperial dropship you can recreate a large battle.Finally I think you should buy it

author: Gus_263
title: Rebels against the empire
review: Another pack, this with four rebel's mini figures, in the rebel scout speeder vehicle. The speeder have a glass on the front, and a weapon on back, this is rotating, and is cool to play. Like all battle packs, is helpful to make an army. One problem is the heads of the rebels, have black paintings, that combine only if using the helmet.

author: _add_um
title: The long awaited minifigs
review:
This only sells really for the figs: 4 rebel soliders. Up to now the only rebels we saw were the hoth soldiers and pilots. The speeder is cool but is too simple there is no control panels and no seats or even the back-rest pieces. The turret can be taken off the speeder too and on the side there are clips to hold the blasters (2 short blasters and 2 long balsters). The set also includes stickers which peel off after a while but you get spar stickers so if they do peel off use the spare ones.

Pros:
*4 Rebels
*buy over and over again to build your army of rebels
*some nice pieces (dark grey slope, rounded falt piece etc)

Cons:
*Speeder too simple

Its a good set but would be bad if it didn't have the rebels included. But we might see a Tantive IV in the near future.

author: David1971
title: Highly satisfactory!
review:
Now this is very nice, and excellent value for £8.99 (UK). For some reason I thought it was like one of the 'battle packs' where you get four minifigs but a tiny extra model. And you *do* get four minifigs (generous for a small set) but also the ship is rather good! It is bigger than I expected - all four guys can get in it (well, three in it and one on the gun turret, but they do all have somewhere to sit!) and it's a nice ship in the well-designed Star Wars style, sleek and stylish.

This is much better value than set 7669: Anakin's Jedi Starfighter, which is £20 and you only get one minifig. How do they come up with these prices?!

author: mrmitch
title: Awesome Value -  Awesome Set !
review: What a great set, quick to build, four - yes 4 rebels to add to your Star Wars collection and a cool speeder all for around $10.00 US dollars. My only complaint is the stickers. You can build up your army if you get two or three of these sets. This set along with 7667, are a great value and a must for all LEGO collections, even if your Star Wars section is limited-this is a must have !

author: brickbuster2409
title: REBELS!
review:
im gonna get straight to the pros and cons for this set.

Pros:
-the long awaited rebel soldiers
-better and different weapons (blaster and sniper rifles)
-great revolving turret
-awesome speeder

Cons:
-stickers
-a bit pricey (i would rather settle for $6-$8)

still a great army builder!

author: Shadow_Crawler
title: Yeah, Rebel ROCKS!
review:
Wow, this set is amazing! I used to hate SW, mostly bacuse of its expensive prices. But, this set change my mind! This is an obviously good set. Let's see...
Box-80/100
Standard box, good CGI picture
Building-90/100
Very fun and a little bit hard when building the base
Playability-100/100
This set has great playability, even if you don't have the Imperial Dropship so they can fight together!
Minifigures-100/100
With 4 Rebel Troopers, armed with heavy blaster, helmet, and a visor, the minifigures is really cool.
Average: 92,5/100-Very Recommended

author: legoguysw
title: Yay! Rebel troopers!
review:
YAY! We finally have rebel ttroops. And they're awesome. The helmets are well designed, the black part is a black visor. There are only four rbels in this set, a capatin or leader would have been nice.
The set itself is basically a speeder with a gun turret that detatches. It holds all the rebels! The sloped pieces are maybe in too big a variety of colours, but thats not really a big problem. The turret has a nice laser, a trans blue stud, simple but good. There are four minifig guns, 2 normal and two long ones. 
Overall, a great set for Rebel fans. Imperial fans might get scared of it.

author: Leggodt94
title: Rebel Soldiers?!? FINALLY!
review:
Let's see, this set was way too small, BUT WHO CARES! It comes with the first-ever original rebel soldiers! YAY! Let's see how it scored: 

          Good things: 
                -it comes with original rebel soldiers! 
                -and it comes with a lot at that 
                -is inexpensive 
                -actuall model is great too 

          Problems: 
                -absolutely NOTHING! 

Yep, this set is just fantastic! If you don't have this set yet, then you really need to get it and while your at it, grab ten more! Great set! :D

author: Smallsam99
title: Prepare the attack on the death star!
review: Finally we get some rebels to go with the star wars theme and I am very glad.The rebels are built very well and are acurate to the movies but the helmets are a little big. The vehicle is also a nice addition to this set. All in all this set is good and worth the price and also includes the first rebels in a long time! I think that after this set they might even make the rebel spaceships. Overall a 10/10 and I reccomend getting one before they all are taken off the shelves, if you don't have one already.

author: Egorredcloak
title: Better then the clones
review:
This is a brilliant set, it represents the rebels seen in Hoth and the  opening seen of episode 4. The helmets are striking and slightly oversized (not really a bad thing). I like the gunship but I didn't buy it for that. 
The troops themselves make excellent rebels or can be used to represent generic human sci-fi troopers.

Love the colour scheme and can't wait for some non-star wars battle packs (representing real world soldiers maybe?)

Worth buying in large numbers, although they are a tad expensive in th UK (then again what isn't here?)

author: starwarsgeek101_
title: It has amazing minifigs!
review: I really only bought the set for the minifigures, and it was worth it! I loved the detailed hat and the torso. The speeder is great too, with the removable turret and its small size. The price is good as well, at only $10, which is why I bought a couple of sets. This is an amazing army builder for the rebels so I recommend this set to you.

author: DSRsoc
title: Cool Set & Rebel Soldiers are awesome!
review: Lego did an awesome job of creating this set for Star Wars collectors.  However, I am by far not a Star Wars collector.  I love this set for a totally opposite reason.  The rebel soldiers look similar to kids in a private/uniform regulated school.  I bought a half dozen of these sets to fill up my school house for my town collection.  Before the classrooms had policemen, firemen, farmers, etc.  you name it and the figure was a student.  Now I have four filled classrooms with all the figures having the same outfits.  These guys are awesome!

author: DarthVader_
title: Awesome set!
review: I really like the set!  I like the rotating cannon and the fact that it comes with four rebels and weapons!  I think it will go good with the other battle pack!  I like playing with my AT-ST and this set together!  I am going to try to get another one!

author: FAHunor
review:
He is a very good little supply!I like the weapons and the people very much equally!The removable tower very good but I did not see this machine in the film from it independent! 

- 4 men 

- 2 lasers pistol 

-2 laser gun

author: Obi_Wan9994
title: WOW!
review:
Of all the small sets I've gotten, this is admittedly one of the best. This set features an all-new figure, the rebel trooper, and guess what, you get four! There's room for 3 troopers on the inside of the vehicle, and space for one on the turret. The scout speeder also features a detachable rotating turret, which works great, and is fun to play with. This set includes four detailed blasters, 2 short, and 2 long, and you get a little holder for each one. This is also a sturdy little set, so go ahead and throw it at a nasty Star Destroyer. This set has great playability, and goes hand in hand with the imperial battle pack. The only thing I didn't like were the stickers, I'd prefer an actual rebel symbol on the pieces, but that's just my personal preference, you might think different. 
I'd recommend this set to people of all ages, because it's easy to build, fun to play with , and it's just a great set overall.

author: Lint
title: All things considered, a good set
review:
Pro's
*4 rebel minifigs
*Giant pivotable blaster cannon

Con's
*Speeder is pretty bland
*Only 4 blasters, 2 big, 2 small, no spares
*Rebels helmets fall off really easily

If you're looking to build a rebel army, this is what you're looking for. Compared to other sets in the same price range its a pretty fair deal.

author: reidak49
title: im back
review: Great set i love those minifigures and there is 4 of them and the speeder is durable the tower can be tooken off am used like an out post finally i have some rebel minifigs now i need a tanative 5 set and some storm toopers

author: bmwlego
title: Glad I Bought This Set!
review: I am NOT a LEGO Star Wars fiend like many of the bricksetters that hang out here on Brickset. However, I must say that I wanted this set the moment I laid eyes on it. The vehicle itself is just a nice, smooth looking speeder that really appealed to me. The 4 Rebel Scouts are really cool and would look just fine in a City diorama as they do not look too Star Wars-ish. The 4 guns are cool as is the cannon atop the speeder. The windshield is a great piece to build with as are the tall inverted slopes at the back of the speeder. I am a City fan and builder (I am working on a Modular building right now to place next to Green Grocer and Cafe Corner right now) but this set has made me want to build a Spaceship MOC. Isn't this what LEGO is supposed to do for us, inspire our imagination? I am really happy I bought this set and at 10 bucks it is a GREAT BUY!

author: jonbuddy
title: Expanded Universe?     (The most owned set right now)
review:
Introduction

  I've had this set for a while, and it's good for what it is.

 

Building Experience

  A very short build. Not much else to say. 4/5

 

Parts

  See that piece on the top of the turret that's the actual "gun"? That's the one piece in the old podracer sets. Probably not the same color, but there is always paint. :)

  The Helmet/Strap-painted-on-the-face combo was very creative on LEGO's part. 5/5

 

Playability

  Has VERY high playability for its size. Get a couple of these and you're set to go for a LEGO SW Rebel Army. 5/5

 

Value for Money

  $10's almost pushing it, but I can't complain much. 4/5

 

Overall/Closing

  Not bad. Not bad at all. Great army-builder and regular set. It makes sense that this is the most owned set.

 

5/5

Actual Average: 28/30, 93.3%

 

(Sorry for a short review)

author: mvila09
title: Great set!
review: I opened this set Friday,and it only took me 15 minutes.Well worth the time!Heres the Pros.Pros 4 Rebel figs,Black Visors,Turret,All minifigs can fit inside,I love the helmets,2 long blasters,2 short blasters,Price,You can make your own battle with the Imperial Dropship.Cons The name is not good,I rather name this set Rebel Battle Pack because if you see the name your going to think its a speeder from Episode VI,but its not.The white in the front doesnt look so good,stickers.*****5 stars.

author: rabk295
title: I might have already reveiwed this set...

The thing I like the most about this set is the minifigs, but more specifically, the helmets. They are awesome and look exactly like they do in the movies. The ship is pretty good, but whenever I use this set, I just make the troopers jump out and the ship explodes. Overall this is a great set and I think that this is the best battle pack. Worth the buy.

title: Definately Want To Get Another!
review: This is one of the best sets I have gotten in a long time. This is my first battle pack that I have gotten along with the storm trooper battle pack. I love their helmets! It also comes with a light blue cylinder which is always nice. Plus some gray slopes. The speeder is awesome and very aerodynamic. Buy this set!

author: THX_1138
title: The best battle pack, in my opinion
review:
This set is actually quite good.
Pros:
-The rebel troopers are awesome! I love those helmets.
-you get four rebel troopers in a $10 set.
-The price is reasonable.
-The speeder is pretty cool. (Finally, a ground vehicle for the Rebels!)
-The detachable turret is pretty cool and actually stands up (something I didn't expect).
Cons:

This is a great army building set considering it is currently the only set with rebel troopers. The speeder is also cool. Get this if you can.

author: Obi_wan_Legobi
title: Finally! Original rebel soldiers and a rebel land attack vehicle!
review: I mean they have X-wings, Y-wings, A-wings, B-wings, turrets, and little transporting vehicles but no land attack vehicles, until now. It may be small, but at least it's something. This set has four original rebel soldiers, the very first rebel land attack vehicle, special places for the blasters, and the vehicle's gun can come off and be used as a turret. The soldiers are cool and nicely detailed, but their large helmets don't stay on too well. Overall, this set is great.

author: scbunch
title: Great addition to collection
review: Great price and great for the mini figs.  Goes well with the imperial drop ship and mini figs.  Easy to build and comes with extra stickers.  Goes well with any collection you're doing.  Highly recommended.

author: AFOSL
title: Not Found In The Movies But Looks Every Bit The Part
review:
Simple design, minimal parts, quick to build, cheap to buy, great army builder.  These are the plus points for this little vehicle, produced purely to help Lego expand it's minifigure line up.
Since Hasbro own the rights to produce Star Wars figures, Lego had to make this craft in order to get their figures out there.
The craft itself is based on typical land speeder design - flatbed, repulsorlift driven, cargo or personel transport for shorter distances.
The build is simple, taking no more than ten minutes to assemble, and to keep the look authentic, the colour palette is a little drab - greys, black and tan.  A few white pieces brighten it up a little, but you won't find any block primary reds, blues or greens here.
The main splash of colour is introduced in the form of stickers.  This might be a bad thing for many.  The stickers are of the plastic kind, instead of paper, and these seem to be more hard wearing, if my memory serves me well.  I recall owning a small truck when I was much younger, and this had plastic stickers.  The stickers never peeled, didn't rot or crack, and never fell off in the ten years I had the vehicle.  Paper based stickers are prone to all of those negatives.
Hopefully the plastic stickers found in this set are as long lived as the plastic stickers found on sets from 25 years ago.
The stickers are very small and hard to place correctly.  The use of tweezers is advisable to help you acheive a perfect finish.
The minifigures are upto Lego's usual high standards and are a must for any Rebel army.  For the collector, these figures are the reason to purchase this set and it should not be overlooked.
Overall, a neat little set, if a little basic for some builders, and the use of (such small and fiddly) stickers lose this set a brick.  4/5

author: ShatteredGnome
title: Sleek Speeder for Your Rebel Army
review:
This speeder isn't actually in the movies, but it fits right in. LEGO did a great job making this set, with the removable turret tower on the back, and being able to carry 4 passengers. This year's battle packs are vehicles that carry the entire set's figures, and while this lacks the WOW! of the dropship's deadly bug-like appearance, it look even bigger when built. I think it actually dwarfs the dropship in size, oddly.

This is the only set where you'll find many rebels, so if you need some bulk for an army or pasengers for a fleet, get this
Overall 9/10

author: Alemas
title: Go Rebels!
review:
This is a great way of getting these all-new Rebels! It has two blasters, two blaster rifle, a detachable turret, and four all-new Rebels!

Pros:

Blasters
Rebels
Detachable turret
Sleek design

Cons:

None!

Overall, a great set!

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Star Wars - Rebel Scout Speeder
review:
The Rebel Scout Speeder set (7668) is a LEGO Star Wars set which came out in 2008. It comes with 4 minifigs and 82 pieces. This set does include a few decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/7668-1.jpg[/img]


Minifigures:

Rebels (4x): The rebels are new with this set. The helmets have new design and the black visor is attached to the helmet. The visor doesn't move. The rebels have gray pants, blue shirts and black vest. They also come with some nice markings on their heads.

Speeder:

The speeder looks very nice. There're 2 blasters on each side and you can put in 3 rebels into the speeder. There's also a turret which you can take of and it does sviwel full 360°. The engine is made out of a piece which LEGO uses for the tyres.

Positive:

Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Nice starter set
Great army builder
Price

Negative:

Not so many play features
Too easy to build

All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de/

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

title: I just depends on what you are looking for...
review:
This is a cool little set and and the guns and people are a good addition to your collection

Pros:

cool guns

not super $$$$
gun holders
rebel logo stickers

Cons:
Small

           Not good if you are more into bricks than minifigs

author: ryancarson
title: Good army builder
review:
This was a fun quick build. Not very challenging, but a nice little set.

I've done an extensive review with photos at: 

http://legostarwars-fans.com/expanded-universe/lego-star-wars-rebel-scout-speeder-7668/

Pros:

- Four new mini-figures
- Detachable gun turret is great for play
- Quick build
- Affordable

Cons:

- Not very challenging
- Rebel Troopers helmets fall off easily

author: alexfig8
title: Pretty Nice set, for the price!
review:
So I got this set back in 2008, and was super excited at the time because 1: The minifigs! and 2: Lego Magazine was at the time running a Star Wars building contest, and I wanted to build the Tantive IV corridor that was at the start of Episode IV.  I never finished the build, but I still got most of it done. 

Pros

  • Fantastic and pretty rare figs
  • Good design
  • 4 Star Wars guns.  FOUR! Nice builder for your Rebel or Clone army
  • Cool turret, which can be removed, which adds to playability

Cons

  • Price is a bit high, but the minifigures make it worth it!

Overall, this set now may go for a bit high, but it is worth it especially if you are trying to build a large Rebel army, as this is only 1 of 2 sets that comes with these figs.  If you can get it for less than $25, go for it.  If it is more, it isn't really worth it.  Thanks for reading, and hope this helped!!

author: DrathMaul1997
title: Where's the seats in this thing?
review:
I will do this review in Parts, here we go...

Mini figs

Not much to say really, this pack is the only way to get (normal) rebel troopers at a cheap price, sadly they all look the same? This is a big con for me, couldn't we even have a sargeant? They come with two blaster rifles and two smaller blasters 

Speeder

Bad, for a start theres no seats! No controls either. The turret is nice, could take a nice chunk out of an AT ST. You can also take it out, though that makes the rest of the speeder look rather empty... When the turret is on and all the mini figs are in it looks very 'sleek' :)

Other

  • -The build is, as you may expect, not very good
  • -over priced, £5 would be a good price. Not £8-10 though!
  • -No more room for extra mini figs...
  • -Over all, good for the mini figures and turret, though not the speeder. If cheap, a Good buy!

author: Huge_Nerd
title: Vader fodder!
review:
pros

  • sleak vehicle
  • fun turret
  • classic Rebel minifigs are great for being shot by Stormtroopers and choked by Vader!
  • decent price

cons

  • a little diversity in the minigs wouldn't hurt

author: blah777curtis1234
title: good set
review: this set is nice to have a few of becase its the only set with more tan 1 reble soldger . but it only has 1 feture , and none of the batle packs have good price.

author: Odeinoichus
title: I'm running out of Star Wars quotes appropriate for the sets.
review:
Set #7668 Rebel Scout Speeder: The second batch of Battle Packs included troop building opportunities for your Rebel army and your Imperial army. And it also introduced the Rebel Scout Trooper Helmet.

 

In fact I believe that this set marks the first time we get to see the LEGO Rebel Trooper represented in Mini-Figure form. Past Starfighter sets only included Technicians and Mechanics as extra Mini-Figures. This set is worth owning more than one of, I'm just sad I only got one of it rather than the three or four necessary to populate the Tantive IV with enough troopers to battle the Stormtroopers.

 

The Rebel Scout Speeder is an interesting vehicle as well, it could fit in with any Yavin IV display I'd wager and it has two seperate pieces, the speeder part which can seat two and the weapon tower that sits a third trooper and is detachable as a stationary defense unit. The stickers for details are minimal and don't get in the way as some stickers have a tendancy of doing, and the fact that you get four Rebel Scout Troopers and four blasters for them is great incentive to pick this set up. If you haven't gotten one already I'd say you should.

author: mad_warning
title: 7668: Rebel Scout Speeder - Gran set de coleccionista.
review:
Para mi, este set es obligatorio en todo coleccionista de Lego Star Wars apesar de que no exista en la galaxia de Star Wars.

Por mi parte, lo compré en ebay junto a su gemelo por parte del imperio, 7667, por 15€ cada uno. Hacía tiempo que quería tenerlo pero los precios de los pocos que quedan en tiendas son muy altos.

Caja/Instrucciones

Desgraciadamente no venían en el lote, pero he podido seguir el montaje gracias a las instrucciones que hay en esta magnífica página. Fácil montaje y divertido.

Partes

El speeder tiene un buen diseño, pero a la hora de sentar a los cuatro minifiguras se hace complicado, por lo que hay que poner una es la torreta.

Para mi sorpresa la torreta se puede quitar y dejar separada del speeder como avanzadilla o apoyo a las tropas que acaban de desembarcar.

 

Minifigures

Contiene cuatro minifiguras con buen diseño de vestuario con sus armas. Son Minifiguras dificil de encontrar y caras. El hecho de que tengan la misma cara o graduación no me parece un handicap para comprarlo. Te abre la imaginación para que los rediseñes.

 

Construcción

Fácil montaje y rápido. Divertido, ya que haces dos partes el speeder y la torreta.

 

Resumen

En resumen lo dicho, es obligatorio tenerlo en la colección. Da mucho juego en una batalla como avanzadilla, aunque para ello haya que comprar al menos dos.

Como ventaja, al menos para mi, tiene ese aire retro que tiene el episodio IV de la guerra de las galaxias.  :)
